page.title: 02LEE-on-the-SOLENT.
page.content: Lee-on-the-Solent is essentially a twentieth century development dating from late Victorian times.It is a small,quiet mostly residential and un- commercialised seaside resort with commanding views of the{Solent}and the {Isle of Wight}.Despite the construction of the railway,pier and tower - all now no longer in existence - Lee did not live up to the expectations of its original planners. Now mainly a dormitory for Gosport, Fareham and Portsmouth,an increasing number of its residents are retired people. Lee-on-the-Solent is well served by local shops and services.These tend to be more traditional in style and goods are generally higher priced.Tourists tend to be day visitors from other local towns as facilities for the long stay tourist are under-developed.
